questions.explanation:
## Why This Is Asked

Tests ability to design tenant isolation, policy-as-code, and robust rollback/auditability in a multi-tenant data lake.

## Key Concepts

- IAM Conditions for resource-scoped access
- Per-data-product VPC Service Controls perimeters
- Private Service Connect for controlled analytics access
- CMEK with rotation for storage
- Synthetic misconfig testing in CI
- Drift-detection and auditable rollback via IaC

## Code Example

```javascript
// Pseudo access check
function canAccess(ctx, dataProduct) {
  if (ctx.tenant !== dataProduct.tenant) return false;
  if (!dataProduct.perimeter.includes(ctx.perimeter)) return false;
  return true;
}
```

## Follow-up Questions

- How would you automate synthetic misconfig tests in CI?
- How would you revoke access when a tenant changes or leaves, and ensure full auditability?

## Why This Is Asked

- IAM Conditions
- Workload Identity Federation
- Access Context Manager
- Time-bounded access
- Revocation & auditing
- Synthetic data validation

## Code Example

```javascript
{
  "bindings": [
    {
      "role": "roles/bigquery.jobUser",
      "members": ["serviceAccount:partner-sa@provider-project.iam.gserviceaccount.com"],

        {
          "title": "TimeWindow",
          "description": "2h access",
```

questions.question: In a **Terraform-driven GCP** multi-tenant environment used by **Salesforce** and **Discord**, implement automated guardrails that block any public bucket or dataset and enforce least-privilege IAM at module boundaries. Describe how you’d implement **OPA constraints**, integrate with **CI/CD**, test with synthetic misconfigs, and provide rollback/auditability?
questions.answer: Enforce via OPA constraints in CI/CD: deny any plan that creates public buckets/datasets and requires least-privilege IAM at module boundaries. Gate Terraform plan with 'opa eval' against a policy bun
questions.explanation:
## Why This Is Asked
This question probes practical, scalable guardrails for IaC in a multi-tenant GCP setup, emphasizing automated policy enforcement and rollback.

## Key Concepts
- OPA constraints in CI/CD for Terraform
- Least-privilege IAM per module boundaries
- Synthetic misconfig tests (Terratest/kitchen-terraform)
- Rollback/auditability via PR reverts and Cloud Audit Logs

## Code Example
```rego
package gcp.authz

deny[msg] {
  input.resource_type == "storage.googleapis.com/Bucket"
  some b
  input.bindings[b].role == "roles/storage.objectAdmin"
  input.bindings[b].members[_] == "allUsers"
  msg = sprintf("Public bucket not allowed: %s", [input.name])
}
```

## Follow-up Questions
- How would you handle false positives in CI gate?
- How would you extend policy to BigQuery datasets and Pub/Sub topics?

  GCP --> Audit[Cloud Audit Logs / Rollback]
